column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: 1 Goals and System Architecture
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column right-indent font-larger hanged-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: The goal of our work is twofold. On the one hand,
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital tailchar-comma

column2: we want to test whether it is possible to implement
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: a competitive SRL system by reducing the task to a
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line itemization headchar-lower

column2: sequential tagging. On the other hand, we want to
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: investigate the effect of replacing partial parsing in-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: formation by full parsing. For that, we built two dif-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ferent individual systems with a shared sequential
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: strategy but using UPC chunks-clauses, and Char-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: niak’s parses, respectively. We will refer to those
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: systems as PP UPC and FP CHA , hereinafter.
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Both partial and full parsing annotations provided
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: as input information are of hierarchical nature. Our
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: system navigates through these syntactic structures
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower column-bottom

column2: in order to select a subset of constituents organized
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified column-top headchar-lower

column2: sequentially (i.e., non embedding). Propositions are
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: treated independently, that is, each target verb gen-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: erates a sequence of tokens to be annotated. We call
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: this pre-processing step sequentialization.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-line-space

column2: The sequential tokens are selected by exploring
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital

column2: the sentence spans or regions defined by the clause
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: boundaries <sup>1</sup> . The top-most syntactic constituents
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: falling inside these regions are selected as tokens.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Note that this strategy is independent of the input
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: syntactic annotation explored, provided it contains
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: clause boundaries. It happens that, in the case of
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: full parses, this node selection strategy is equivalent
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: to the pruning process defined by Xue and Palmer
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: (2004), which selects sibling nodes along the path of
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line year

column2: ancestors from the verb predicate to the root of the
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: tree <sup>2</sup> . Due to this pruning stage, the upper-bound re-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: call figures are 95.67% for PP UPC and 90.32% for
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: FP CHA . These values give F 1 performance upper
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: bounds of 97.79 and 94.91, respectively, assuming
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: perfect predictors (100% precision).
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-line-space

column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital

column2: depending if they are at the beginning, inside, or out-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: side of a verb argument. There is a total of 37 argu-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: We trained the classification models using the com-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: plete training set (sections from 02 to 21). Once con-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: verted into one sequence per target predicate, the re-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: sulting set amounts 1,049,049 training examples in
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the PP UPC model and 828,811 training examples in
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the FP CHA model. The average number of labels per
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: argument is 2.071 and 1.068, respectively. This fact
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: makes “I” labels very rare in the FP CHA model.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: When running AdaBoost, we selected as weak
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: rules decision trees of fixed depth 4 (i.e., each branch
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: may represent a conjunction of at most 4 basic fea-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tures) and trained a classification model per label for
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: up to 2,000 rounds.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: We applied some simplifications to keep training
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: times and memory requirements inside admissible
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: bounds. First, we discarded all the argument la-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: bels that occur very infrequently and trained only
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the 41 most frequent labels in the case of PP UPC
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: and the 35 most frequent in the case of FP CHA .
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: The remaining labels where joined in a new label
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: “other” in training and converted into “O” when-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line tailchar-hiphen

column2: ever the SRL system assigns a “other” label dur-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ing testing. Second, we performed a simple fre-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: quency filtering by discarding those features occur-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ring less than 15 times in the training set. As an
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower column-bottom above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space
page=1 xpos=4 ypos=9 single-column left-indent right-indent column-top line-blank-line line-double-space line-space numeric-only page-bottom

column2: exception, the frequency threshold for the features
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified page-top headchar-lower

column2: referring to the verb predicate was set to 3. The final
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: number of features we worked with is 105,175 in the
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: case of PP UPC and 80,742 in the case of FP CHA .
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Training with these very large data and feature
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: sets becomes an issue. Fortunately, we could split
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: the computation among six machines in a Linux
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: cluster. Using our current implementation combin-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ing Perl and C++ we could train the complete mod-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: els in about 2 days using memory requirements be-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tween 1.5GB and 2GB. Testing with the ensembles
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: of 2,000 decision trees per label is also not very effi-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: cient, though the resulting speed is admissible, e.g.,
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: the development set is tagged in about 30 minutes
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: using a standard PC.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: The overall results obtained by our individual
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: PP UPC and FP CHA SRL systems are presented in ta-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: ble 1, with the best results in boldface. As expected,
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: the FP CHA system significantly outperformed the
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: PP UPC system, though the results of the later can
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: be considered competitive. This fact is against the
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: belief, expressed as one of the conclusions of the
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: CoNLL-2004 shared task, that full-parsing systems
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-capital

column2: are about 10 F 1 points over partial-parsing systems.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: In this case, we obtain a performance difference of
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: 2.18 points in favor of FP CHA .
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail numbered-heading2 tailchar-period

column2: Apart from resulting performance, there are addi-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: tional advantages when using the FP CHA approach.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Due to the coarser granularity of sequence tokens,
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital tailchar-comma

column2: FP CHA sequences are shorter. There are 21% less
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: training examples and a much lower quantity of “I”
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: tags to predict (the mapping between syntactic con-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: stituents and arguments is mostly one-to-one). As
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: a consequence, FP CHA classifiers train faster with
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line itemization headchar-lower

column2: less memory requirements, and achieve competitive
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: results (near the optimal) with much less rounds of
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: boosting. See figure 1. Also related to the token
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: granularity, the number of completely correct out-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: puts is 4.13 points higher in FP CHA , showing that
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the resulting labelings are structurally better than
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: those of PP UPC .
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Interestingly, the PP UPC and FP CHA systems
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: make quite different argument predictions. For in-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: stance, FP CHA is better at recognizing A0 and A1
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: arguments since parse constituents corresponding to
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: these arguments tend to be mostly correct. Compar-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: atively, PP UPC is better at recognizing A2-A4 argu-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ments since they are further from the verb predicate
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space
page=2 xpos=4 ypos=9 left-column left-indent right-over indented-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space numeric-only column-bottom

column2: Table 1: Overall results of the individual systems on
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified line-double-space line-space string-table headchar-capital

column2: the development set.
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: and tend to accumulate more parsing errors, while
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-lower

column2: the fine granularity of the PP UPC sequences still al-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: low to capture them <sup>4</sup> . Another interesting observa-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tion is that the precision of both systems is much
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: higher than the recall.
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-line-space

column2: The previous two facts suggest that combining the
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital

column2: outputs of the two systems may lead to a significant
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: improvement. We experimented with a greedy com-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: bination scheme for joining the maximum number of
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: arguments from both solutions in order to increase
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: coverage and, hopefully, recall. It proceeds depart-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ing from an empty solution by: First, adding all the
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: arguments from FP CHA in which this method per-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: forms best; Second, adding all the arguments from
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: PP UPC in which this method performs best; and
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: Third, making another loop through the two meth-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: ods adding the arguments not considered in the first
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: loop. At each step, we require that the added argu-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ments do not overlap/embed with arguments in the
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: current solution and also that they do not introduce
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: repetitions of A0-A5 arguments. The results on the
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower above-double-space above-line-space

column2: <sup>4</sup> As an example, the F 1 performance of PP UPC on A0 and
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column left-indent indented-line line-double-space line-space headchar-super

column2: A2 arguments is 79.79 and 65.10, respectively. The perfor-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified font-smallest hanged-line headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: mance of FP CHA on the same arguments is 84.03 and 62.36.
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column right-indent font-smallest aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period page-bottom

column2: __Table 2__
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=-1 left-column left-indent right-indent box page-top table-area above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Table 2: Overall results (top) and detailed results on
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified hanged-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space string-table headchar-capital

column2: the WSJ test (bottom).
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: development set (presented in table 1) confirm our
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-lower

column2: expectations, since a performance increase of 1.18
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: points over the best individual system was observed,
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: mainly caused by recall improvement. The final sys-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tem we presented at the shared task performs exactly
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: this solution merging procedure. When applied on
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the WSJ test set, the combination scheme seems to
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: generalize well, since an improvement is observed
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: with respect to the development set. See the offi-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: cial results of our system, which are presented in ta-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ble 2. Also from that table, it is worth noting that the
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: F 1 performance drops by more than 9 points when
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: tested on the Brown test set, indicating that the re-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: sults obtained on the WSJ corpora do not generalize
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower column-bottom

column2: well to corpora with other genres. The study of the
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified column-top headchar-lower

column2: sources of this lower performance deserves further
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: investigation, though we do not believe that it is at-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tributable to the greedy combination scheme.

column2: 3 Conclusions
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column right-indent font-larger aligned-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: We have presented a simple SRL system submit-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: ted to the CoNLL-2005 shared task, which treats
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower

column2: the SRL problem as a sequence tagging task (us-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ing a BIO tagging scheme). Given the simplic-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ity of the approach, we believe that the results are
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: very good and competitive compared to the state-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: of-the-art. We also provided a comparison between
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: two SRL systems sharing the same architecture, but
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: build on partial vs. full parsing, respectively. Al-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: though the full parsing approach obtains better re-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: sults and has some implementation advantages, the
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: partial parsing system shows also a quite competi-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tive performance. The results on the development
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: set differ in 2.18 points, but the outputs generated
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: by the two systems are significantly different. The
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: final system, which scored F 1 =76.59 in the official
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: test set, is a combination of both individual systems
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: aiming at increasing coverage and recall.
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space
